channel.title: math.CT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.CT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A characterization of differential bundles in tangent categories
item.description: arXiv:2407.06515v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A tangent category is a categorical abstraction of the tangent bundle construction for smooth manifolds. In that context, Cockett and Cruttwell develop the notion of differential bundle which, by work of MacAdam, generalizes the notion of smooth vector bundle to the abstract setting. Here we provide a new characterization of those differential bundles and show that, up to isomorphism, a differential bundle is determined by its projection map and zero section. We show how these results can be used to quickly identify differential bundles in various tangent categories.
item.dc:creator: Michael Ching

item.title: Diagrammatic sets as a model of homotopy types
item.description: arXiv:2407.06285v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Diagrammatic sets are presheaves on a rich category of shapes, whose definition is motivated by combinatorial topology and higher-dimensional diagram rewriting. These shapes include representatives of oriented simplices, cubes, and positive opetopes, and are stable under operations including Gray products, joins, suspensions, and duals. We exhibit a cofibrantly generated model structure on diagrammatic sets, as well as two separate Quillen equivalences with the classical model structure on simplicial sets. We construct explicit sets of generating cofibrations and acyclic cofibrations, and prove that the model structure is monoidal with the Gray product of diagrammatic sets.
item.dc:creator: Cl\'emence Chanavat, Amar Hadzihasanovic

item.title: Hidden structures behind ambient symmetries of the Maurer-Cartan equation
item.description: arXiv:2407.06589v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: For every differential graded Lie algebra $\mathfrak{g}$ one can define two different group actions on the Maurer-Cartan elements: the ubiquitous gauge action and the action of $\mathrm{Lie}_\infty$-isotopies of $\mathfrak{g}$, which we call the ambient action. In this note, we explain how the assertion of gauge triviality of a homologically trivial ambient action relates to the calculus of dendriform, Zinbiel, and Rota-Baxter algebras, and to Eulerian idempotents. In particular, we exhibit new relationships between these algebraic structures and the operad of rational functions defined by Loday.
item.dc:creator: Vladimir Dotsenko, Sergey Shadrin

item.title: A Model Categoric Equivalence for Crossed Simplicial Groups
item.description: arXiv:2402.19291v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Using coinduction and restriction functors, we show that the category of simplicial $\Bbbk$-vector spaces and the category of $\Bbbk$-representations of a crossed simplicial group are equivalent after inverting homotopy equivalences. We do this by first showing that the homotopical version of the original Dold-Kan equivalence is implemented by an adjoint pair of coinduction and restriction functors after a suitable homotopy localization. Finally, we rewrite our equivalence for crossed simplicial objects as a model categorical equivalence.
item.dc:creator: Haydar Can Kaya, Atabey Kaygun
